categories: Category:Unidentified Jedi of the Jedi Order

nodes.text: A blue-skinned, black-eyed Chagrian male served as a member of the Jedi Order's High Council around 3997 BBY. The Chagrian, along with his Human colleagues, grew concerned with the Jedi Padawan Exar Kun and the eagerness of the latter to study the dark side of the Force, which was shunned by the Order. The Jedi Council claimed that Kun's desire for knowledge was beginning to resemble a thirst for power, and the young Jedi indeed fell to the dark side around 3997 BBY.

In a historical record composed by Jedi Master Gnost-Dural following the signing of the Treaty of Coruscant more than three centuries later, the Chagrian member of the High Council and his colleagues were depicted against the backdrop of a high-ceilinged hall. In the record, the Chagrian was wearing dark red and dark brown robes.

The Chagrian Jedi appeared in The Exar Kun War, the tenth installment of the Galactic Timeline series of videos published on the official website for Star Wars: The Old Republic, a 2011 massively multiplayer online roleplaying game developed by BioWare.

In The Exar Kun War, which was released on October 15, 2010, the depiction of the Chagrian is identical in appearance, clothing, and pose to a promotional photograph for the 1999 prequel trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace, of Jerome Blake portraying Mas Amedda, Vice Chair of the Galactic Republic's Senate.
